title: Bob Tubman
text:
Robert Tubman (6 June 1884 – 17 December 1956) was a pioneer Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer, one of his country's first selected <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">national representatives</a>.
Playing career.
Tubman was a registered <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player in Queensland in 1908 at the time of the rugby league code's inaugural competition year in Australia. He was selected in the first ever <a href="Queensland%20Maroons">Queensland Maroons</a> state representative side to play the new <a href="Rugby%20league">"Northern Union" style of rugby</a>, taking on <a href="Albert%20Henry%20Baskerville">Albert Baskerville's</a> <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand All Golds</a> on their <a href="1907%E2%80%931908%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20Great%20Britain">inaugural tour</a>. He would go to make fourteen state appearances over the next three years against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a>, <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori rugby league team</a>.
When the New Zealand team came back on the return leg of their tour, they played three <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20league%29">Test matches</a> against the first <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian representative</a> sides ever selected. The first Test was played in Sydney on 9 May 1908 with the Kiwis prevailing. Tubman played in that Test at prop-forward and has been allocated Kangaroo representative No. 14. Tubman and his Queensland former rugby union colleagues <a href="Micky%20Dore">Micky Dore</a> and <a href="Doug%20McLean%20snr">Doug McLean snr</a> were all disqualified by the <a href="Queensland%20Rugby%20Union">Queensland Rugby Union</a> within days.
During the 1910 <a href="The%20Ashes%20%28rugby%20league%29">Ashes series</a> played in Australia, Tubman made his 2nd and final national representative appearance in the second-row.
